docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- Today in South America, it is a rare hotel or restaurant man who does not understand the needs and whims of visitors from the United States. The problem is that many North Americans come here without a proper education in the customs...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- Today in South America, it is a rare hotel or restaurant man who does not understand the needs and whims of visitors from the United States. The problem is that many North Americans come here without a proper education in the customs of this continent, let alone the caprices.

docs.snippet: LONDON, March 9 -- The Olympic movement is facing its biggest crisis since the Games were staged in Hitler's Germany in 1936. The summer Games in Mexico have been jeopardized because of the re-entry of segregationist South Africa.

docs.snippet: LONDON, March 13 -- Britain, trying to close down the empire, has run into problems with 2,000 islanders living 8,000 miles from here. They want to remain British -- and that could prove awkward.
